string.text: Greetings... How are you feeling?
I've got no strength left, I'm stumbling... Who are you? And who am I?

You didn't recognize me? That's a pity, I was hoping you would.\nI am the Doctor—many call me the Swamp Doctor, as I used to live in the swamps... I heard they found you and came to take a look. As for who you are... I'm not sure yet, you've taken quite a beating. I have a hunch, but it's too incredible. Until you remember for yourself, I won't say; there is too much danger that you'll build a personality around a name that isn't yours. For now, just relax... Perhaps you'll meet someone you know—memory loss often requires an external jolt.\nGo, talk to Sidorovich; he was nursing you back to health while I was away. As for me, I'll head slowly toward the center of the Zone.
Doctor? I don't remember... Sidorovich? Where, what... Ugh... my head...
Take a medkit, eat something, drink some water. It'll perk you up.
Ah... thanks.
I see you've recovered a bit. Anything come back to you yet?
No, I haven't remembered... I'll look for those who can help.
Right then! We'll meet again...
Find the document for Wolf
Find Nimble and his flash drive
Pal, you should get out of here. If you don't go willingly, we'll help you along as best we can.
What's gotten into you guys?
Hey! What do you want?
Hello!
Our leader wanted to see you. But that doesn't mean you're welcome here. Keep moving, don't loiter.
Get lost, we're all gonna go up in smoke because of you.
Don't sweat it, you'll fight 'em off.
Hello, stalker. Hm, life's certainly taken its toll on you. You here to see me? People call me Guide, what should I call you?
Same to you. I'm the Marked One. Haven't heard of me?
Marked One... I think I've heard you've been stirring up quite a ruckus. What did you want from me? You seem pretty resourceful yourself.
I'm looking for Strelok. Ever heard of him? Word is, you had a photograph. One with this Strelok in it.
Maybe I did... You are a guide, after all.
Yeah, and I'm not a loner. How about you stop pulling the pseudo-cat by its pseudo-tail and get straight to the point...

About Strelok? Course I have. Who hasn't? About a year ago he caused a lot of noise up north. Plenty of folks would love to have a word with him. He was lucky. Or so they say...
As for the photo...
I didn't even know it was Strelok and his crew. Found it by chance. Took it off a dead man in the Red Forest.
Another stalker told me it was Strelok, Ghost, and a couple of other guys.
Can I take a look at it?

Eh... I don't have it anymore. Doctor was here recently; I showed it to him and he went and asked for it for keeps. Said he wanted to show it to someone himself. What do I need it for anyway?
He set me up with a bottle for my health.
Then he waddled off. Said he was going to visit a friend, supposedly in the Agroprom underground. What the hell he's looking for there is beyond me! If you really need to know, I can show you the way...
If you don't mind parting with a Tier 2 artifact, I'll tell you about a direct path from here straight to Agroprom. Save you a lot of time. Deal?
Don't have one on me. Maybe later.
Is that the path through the Settlement? I already know that one.
Suit yourself.
That's the one. Well, since you already know it, don't bring it up again.
Hey, friend... How's it going? Not seeing double yet? Fancy a glass, or are you trying to find out something important again?
I'm trying, I'm trying... It's just that all my attempts seem to be going sideways.
Just take a breather, man. Relax. You'll see, things will turn the right way eventually.
Greetings, Marked One. How are you holding up?
Fine for now. About that direct path to Agroprom.
Didn't we already agree? No? A Tier 2 artifact and I'll map out a safe trail for you.
I've got an artifact, here you go.
I've got an even better one, here.

I appreciate it... Now listen close. There's a direct path to Agroprom. Cross the road and head past the farm, go beyond the tunnel under the railway, and you'll see two boulders. Behind them is a collapsed wire fence. Go through that and follow the untrodden trail straight to the Forgotten Village; from there, it's just a few steps to Agroprom. Good luck to you.
By the way, do you happen to know anything interesting about Strelok's group or its stash?

Nah... Just heard various tales out of the corner of my ear... you know how people talk. As for the stash, all I know is that it exists, Doctor himself let it slip... if he wasn't pulling my leg, that is. Hm... come to think of it, maybe that's where he's meeting his friend?!
Anything's possible. Alright, since you don't know anything else about Strelok and his crew, I'll be going...
Alright then, watch your step out there.
Healthy? Good to see it. I was starting to have my doubts.
Hey there, buddy. Wolf already gave us the heads-up. You got any more questions for me?
What's the situation? Where's Nimble? What's the plan?

The Bandits kidnapped Nimble. They didn't scrap him right away, they're shaking him down for something. Seems they want something from him. So, we're gonna try and knock the sense out of those punks... You with me?
Think we can talk to them? Seems to me if the lead starts flying, they'll finish Nimble off instantly!
They're just thugs! You can't reason with 'em, you'll just catch a bullet for your trouble... We'll try to pull this off fast so they don't even have time to scratch their heads. Get it?
Yeah. How many bandits are in the camp?

Seven or eight guys. Two near the gates, two in the right building by the fire, and two in the building on the left, that's where they're holding Nimble. Someone usually wanders around the yard too... that's about it. So, shall we get to it, God willing?
Let's do it. Get your boys ready.
No. I'll try to handle it myself to keep things quiet.
Suit yourself. If things go south, just holler... Rambo.
Seven or eight?! That's a suicide mission! We need another way...
Listen here, wise guy! What do you suggest? Sitting in the bushes and admiring the sky?
Well... Sidorovich mentioned something about having ties with the military? I don't know... I just don't think we'll save Nimble with a frontal assault.
I get it! But what are we supposed to do?\nFine, go back and talk to Wolf. I don't want to discuss this stuff over the radio. Maybe he can organize some support or something...
Yeah, I think that would be for the best.
Hm... Let me try to do something quietly. Alone.
I get it! But what are we supposed to do?\nWolf is dead, and Sidor couldn't care less about people...
Well? Did you go? What's the verdict?
We haven't come up with anything yet...
What else... we gotta storm the place, that's what!
Ha! Exactly what I said! So, shall we? The boys and I will try to create a distraction from the right, and you flank them from the left...
Yeah, I talked to him. Basically, I'm gonna try to find that PDA the bandits are after myself. I'm heading to the Gut.

The hunters there demand a toll for passage, you got any? Here, take this pseudodog tail; give it to them if they ask. They'll let you through no questions asked. Just don't loiter near the ATP! Give it a wide berth!
Right, got it, I'll keep my distance. I'm off.
You told me already! Now get a move on! Make up your mind—how and what we're doing!
It's... my head isn't quite right... Anyway, I'm off.
I'll try to negotiate. I'm going in unarmed...
Are you crazy?! Look... they'll smoke you! You sick in the head or something?
We'll see. Just back me up if things go south...
I spoke with Nimble. They're demanding some gadget from him. I'm gonna go consult with Wolf.
Just don't drag this out too long! We'll wait half a day at most. If we don't hear from you by then, we're gonna give those bastards some hell!
I understand, I'll try to make it quick...
It's all sorted. The bandits let Nimble go and they're moving out.
Damn, you're a real ace! I didn't think you had it in you to settle it like that... Seriously—you've got my respect, Marked One! Swing by sometime and we'll have a drink.
I'll drop in. If I get the chance.
I Found some kind of PDA, I'm gonna go show them. Keep your eyes peeled, we might have to fight our way out.
Don't you worry! We've got your back.
I hope so...
Wolf is dead, I don't know what to do...
Damn... we couldn't save Nimble. But at least we took those freaks down.\nSo, what about you, Marked One? How are you holding up?\nIf I ask you for a favor, think you could help me out?
That was one hell of a firefight... I reckon Wolf will be pleased.\nThink you could help me out with one more thing?
Wolf? You, uh, hold your horses on the favors... I need to talk to Wolf first!
We haven't got 'em all yet! Find those bastards and take them out!
Man, you're a real ace! I didn't expect that from you. Settling it like that... Well, bottom line, you've got my respect, Marked One!\nThink you could help me out with something else?
So where are the piles of fallen enemies? Typical! You're all talk and no action... Get lost!
Hey, Marked One. How's life treating you...
Oh... Who are you? Ah! Whatever... What do you want? Think you can help me?
Ah, it's you... What do you want? Gonna help, or what? If not, just keep on walking.
Hold it right there, stalker! No one in the camp is gonna talk to you right now.
Why not?
Fine, have it your way.
You'd have to be a complete idiot to shoot the breeze with a passenger from a Death Truck! You go prove you're worth dealing with first.
What Death Truck? I don't remember anything... nothing at all.

Hell if I know... but they're nasty business, not much in this world is worse than those...\nAnyway, I shouldn't be talking about this with you! Call me superstitious, but you'd better beat it right now, pal, while we're still being nice about it.
What do I have to do to make you guys trust me?

Let Sidorovich vet you while we keep an eye out. If you're a straight shooter, don't go waving your gun around for no reason, and generally have a head on your shoulders, we'll find common ground eventually. Don't sweat it.
Hey, Marked One. What do you need?
Our leader wanted to see you. But that doesn't mean you're welcome here. Head on in, and don't linger.
Get lost before our boys knock some teeth out, you moron!
What the hell! You lose your mind? Looking for a fat lip?
We told you, don't touch the military! But no! You had to go and do it... Now life's gonna be hell for everyone!
Chill out, rookie...
Listen, Marked One, talk about good timing! Wolf said you're a tough nut to crack. We could really use your skills right about now.
What's happened? and who are you, exactly?

I'm Fanatic. I'm in charge here now that Wolf's gone. Yesterday, a few guys showed up, looked like bandits, but serious types, d-damn it... They came and laid it on thick: said we have one day to clear out of the camp, that this is their base now. They're supposed to come back today, and as you can guess, it won't end with just talk this time.
So, what have you decided to do?

We've decided to set an ambush, because I'm afraid we won't hold out in a head-on fight. The ones who came were well-equipped, and you could tell they know which end of a gun to hold... And here—I've got mostly kids. Anyway, we decided to hunker down quietly in the houses, make it look like we left, and attack when the moment is right. We're desperate for fighters like you right now. We'll settle up afterward, don't you worry! So, will you help?

It's all very strange. Why would anyone want this half-ruined village on the edge of the Zone, especially right under the military's nose? Seems to me it was just an excuse to start trouble... they're looking for something, or someone.

Oh, maybe you know why? You're a pretty shady character yourself, from what I see... No one really knows where you came from, and you either don't remember or you're playing dumb... I'm not sure I like this. No one touched this pond until you showed up!
You what?! Who do you take me for? Does the fact that I've been breaking my back for Sidor, doing jobs for Wolf, and helping out stalkers not count? I'm curious myself as to why they showed up...
Alright, sorry... just the stress talking. I don't get the point of this uninvited visit myself. So, will you help us?
I'll help.
No, I've got enough of my own headaches. Figure it out yourselves.

I suggest we spend the remaining time preparing for the fight. Here's the plan: I'll send the greenest rookies to hide in the houses and cellars with orders not to show their faces, or the boys will get slaughtered for nothing... You, me, and a couple of the more experienced guys will take up positions with good firing lines around the campfire. As soon as they reach the fire, we let 'em have it from all sides! They'll be coming from the direction of the bridge... soon, I think. So, find some cover with a good view, and we'll start on my signal. I mean, it's up to you, obviously—but I think there's little chance of surviving out in the open. You decide.
Alright.
Yeah, I figured as much, you don't care about anything or anyone but your own skin. Guess we'll have to manage on our own then... What are you still standing there for? Beat it.
We're just waiting for these fine gentlemen. I have a feeling they'll be here any minute.
I'm ready.

You're a terrifying man, Marked One! Remind me never to get on your bad side. You handled that brilliantly! And those bastards weren't exactly born yesterday either—they had the sense to enter the village from two directions at once.
Yeah. Consider ourselves lucky we got off easy.
Here, take a couple of artifacts and some ammo as a souvenir from us. Shake on it! If you ever need anything, come by and we'll talk.
Hey, Marked One, good to see you!
Hello to you too.
By the way, where did Wolf disappear to?
Good to shake hands. Heh.

He got some kind of message from a passing stalker recently. He packed up immediately, grabbed a crate of dynamite, and headed for the Warehouses. I was just recovering from a wound, so he asked me to keep an eye on the rookies.
Roll on out of here, man! Always people wandering around...
Oh, look at you, so sensitive. Like I really need you guys anyway.
Now that's what I call a rescue, brother! You really bailed me out! I don't even know how to thank you...
But I do. I need the flash drive you were carrying for the trader. I'm here on his behalf. Do you have it on you?
You bet! You saved my life, after all, so no questions asked, take it. These idiots don't even know how to search a man properly, and I'm an expert at hiding valuables.
Hm... and where were you keeping it, if you don't mind me asking? You never know, might come in handy someday.

Not below the belt, don't worry. I've been in the courier business a long time and I've got my professional secrets, so sorry—can't share those.\nAnyway, I'm heading back to camp. Although, I'd better stay out of Sidor's sight for a while—he'll chew me out for sure. Why the hell did I decide to stop by that sawmill...
May your roads be like velvet, stalker!
Sidorovich, you called for me?
Marked One, I’ve been doing some thinking in my spare time and I want to offer you something... In the grand scheme of things, you need to find this Strelok person, right?
Let's say I do.

Well, I've found out a few things about Strelok. There really is such a stalker. Was, at least—there hasn't been a peep out of him for months. They say he found a way to the north of the Zone. Untouched territory, a real Klondike... m-hm...\nBasically, I'll help you track him down, but as you can imagine, it’s not just out of the goodness of my heart. You'll have to earn it. On the bright side, everyone wins: you deal with your Strelok business and find out what happened to you, and I'll find... well, I mean, I’ll gain something from our cooperation. Eh? Deal?
Keep going, I'm listening.

You’re a serious man, I can tell. We need people like you.\nMe and the other traders are conducting an investigation. We want to find a path north, to the center of the Zone, but something or someone is blocking the way. God knows how your Strelok managed to slip through... You see, there's a place up there where your brains just boil. Nasty stuff... m-hm... But to the point. Recently, a rumor started that some important documents fell into military hands. In fact, they’ve been showing some unhealthy activity around Agroprom lately. It’s possible the two are directly related, or maybe it’s just a coincidence. Word is those documents contain info on how to safely bypass the "brain-scrambling" area. So: everything the military has dug up is currently stored in the main building of the research institute. Guarded, of course—goes without saying... but we really need it. Do you catch my drift?
Not quite. You want me to go storm a guarded military facility based on some vague hunch of yours? Have you lost your damn mind, "esteemed" sir?

You're joking, I'm laughing. Don't go twisting my words! Who said anything about "storming"? I’m telling you that we need to find out as much detail as possible about this whole business with the documents and the suspicious military activity. Of course, getting the documents themselves would be ideal, but I’m a realist... So, I suggest you just head to Agroprom for starters and look around.\nBy the way, a few soldiers from over there came by the other day asking for vodka. They mentioned that a couple of boys deserted recently. Supposedly they're holed up not far from the base, out in the swamp. Try to get the full story out of them. Clearer now?
Clearer. Talk to the deserters, see what's what.
Exactly! Well, if you suddenly manage to get your hands on something tangible by any means, make sure you bring it straight to me.
Alright.

I'll upload the coordinates and the necessary info to your PDA. To put it simply: head north through the Garbage, then turn west; after a couple of kilometers, you'll come right out at Agroprom. By the way, there are more artifacts in the Garbage than here, but the radiation there is off the charts in some spots. So, I'd suggest buying some antirad or vodka from me. Otherwise, you'll be glowing like a Christmas tree... heh-heh. Just a little joke! Anyway, good luck.
I want to talk about your assignment to head over to Agroprom.
I'm all ears. Did you find out about the documents or what?

Yeah, I found out. But first things first. I met a soldier there, one of the deserters you mentioned. He told me the military is planning to sweep the Agroprom outskirts. They're bringing in some kind of commission at the end of the summer, world-renowned scientists and all that. That's why there's such a noticeable ruckus.

I found a photo album. That draftee I told you about used it to hide the papers you're so interested in. He tucked the sheets between the photos, so everything is safe and sound, even though it's been sitting in the damp... in a cellar. Here, take it.
I haven't had the chance yet. Actually, I think I was poorly prepared. I need to stock up on gear first.
Blast it all! That's bad news. I'll need to put out a warning over the stalker network. Well, what about the documents?
Ekh, Marked One... Fine, have a look, take your pick. Your money, our goods.

I managed to find out the following. Somewhere near Agroprom, the military gunned down a couple of stalks coming from the Gut. They had a briefcase full of scientific papers. I suspect that briefcase is out of reach now, or maybe they've already shipped it out of the Zone. But one rookie managed to swipe a few pages from that briefcase and hide them later...
I see, I see. And? I'd be very curious to have a look at them.

I bet you are... This album belonged to the draftee who swiped the papers you're so interested in. He tucked the stolen goods between the photos, so everything is safe and sound, even though it's been sitting in the damp... in a certain cellar. Here, take it.
I'm working on that right now. They're hidden in a real nasty spot. I'll drop by later.

Hm... yes, interesting. Not quite what I was hoping for, but still. I'll need to sit down and mull this all over. You can go for now. Oh, and take this album back with you, I don't need the extra scrap paper, I've got nowhere to put it as it is.
Wait... what, just "go" like that? I risked my life getting those scribbles for you, for your information!

Alright, stop whining. Take this as a token of my gratitude. Since you're such a tough guy and managed to handle this assignment, head over to the Bar. The trader there—Barkeep—could also use the help of a capable stalker. I'll give him a heads-up and signal the Duty guys at the checkpoint just in case, so they let you through without any trouble.\nOne more thing. If you happen to come across any other documents like these, bring them to me. I'll pay well. Now get going, I need to think.
Sidorovich, I got your message. What kind of business has cropped up?

More like a problem... Here's the deal. The new commander of the security battalion wants to replace the entire old command staff. He doesn't like the fact that we've found common ground with them. This bastard—rot his soul—has gathered some "facts": various financial documents, photographs, and the like. He plans to hand all this over to the military prosecutor's office. To keep anyone from getting suspicious, he sent all the current officers to the Dark Valley to butt heads with Borov’s gang. Whoever stays alive and returns will be arrested on the spot. This could end badly for me... and for other stalkers too. It'll be hard to get certain goods, and smuggling loot will become much more difficult.
Don't feed me that crap, okay? It'll be harder for you, not the stalkers.

Fine, have it your way. Satisfied? Look, Marked One, you scratch my back, I scratch yours! I've got info from a contact of mine on how to help you with your memory. See? I’m looking out for you, I haven't forgotten—so you don't forget either. If this all pans out, I'll tell you how to meet him. I think you two can reach an agreement... So, how about it?
Quit beating around the bush already. What specifically do you want from me?

All the blackmail material is currently stored at the checkpoint. Right now, an officer loyal to the new commander is on duty there with his goons. We need to get that damn suitcase of documents. I've done some recon... the soldiers there still remember my generosity. Obviously, storming the checkpoint isn't an option. Plus, there's an APC right at the entrance. Even if you swipe the case quietly, they'll make life hell for everyone. The military will shake everyone down and smoke us out of here while they're at it.
So what’s the plan then?

You can't just pull the documents out of the suitcase, it’s locked with a combination. Our good friend Kuznetsov has an idea: if we could find an identical case and swap it on the sly. That way, we can frame the battalion commander himself while we stay above suspicion. Let him deal with his own mess. Anyway, Kuznetsov suggests trying to find the same kind of case. This commander must have gotten it from somewhere here in the Zone; one of the local stalker craftsmen made it. And how many of those are there? You can count them on one hand. Try to find out. Start with Vergas, maybe he can give you a lead. But you've got to resolve this quickly. We have four days at most. After that, a scheduled chopper arrives with supplies for the military, and they'll use it to ferry the case back to the mainland.\nHere, look... this is a photo of the suitcase. I'm uploading it to your PDA. If you find one like it, rush straight back to me. I'll manage to strike a deal with one of the conscripts to organize the swap. You'll just need to drop the case off at the specified time and place.
I'll see what I can do.

You know, I think I'll pass. I have no desire to get caught in the middle of a military squabble. If things go south, you'll wiggle your way out somehow, but if they find out I was involved—I'm a dead man.

Marked One, drop everything else, this is vital. And I'll make it worth your while. I'll tell you about my contact and throw in something for the road. If you solve this suitcase business, then Kuznetsov will be give you a bi-i-ig thank you when he returns, I'm sure of it. Remember— we only have four days, but I'll be waiting for you right here until the swap is done. Just don't come barging in at night; my sleep is sacred.
And I was really counting on you, Marked One...
Sidorovich is asking me to find a similar briefcase. To start, I need to ask Vergas which of the repairmen is capable of making such a thing.

A bit of a problem has cropped up... The new commander of the security battalion wants to replace the entire old command staff. He doesn't like that we've found a common language with them. This bastard, may he rot, has gathered some facts: various documents, photographs, and the like. He plans to hand all this over to the military prosecutor's office. To avoid suspicion, he sent all the officers to the Dark Valley to scrap with Borov's gang. Whoever survives and returns will be arrested on the spot. This could end badly for me... and for other stalkers too—it'll be hard to get certain goods, and smuggling loot out will become much more difficult.
Sidor, don't feed me that crap. It'll be harder for you, not the stalkers.

Fine, this is for me personally! Look, Marked One, you scratch my back, I scratch yours! I have info from my contact on how to help you with your memory! See, I'm looking out for you, I haven't forgotten—so you don't forget either. If this works out, I'll tell you how to meet him. I think you'll find common ground... So, how about it?
Quit beating around the bush already. What specifically do you want from me?

All the blackmail material is currently kept at the checkpoint. An officer loyal to the new commander is on duty there now with his goons. We need to get that damn suitcase of documents. I've done some recon... the soldiers still remember my generosity. Obviously, storming the checkpoint isn't an option... especially with that APC at the entrance. Even if you swipe the case quietly, they'll make life hell for everyone. The military will shake everyone down and smoke us out of here while they're at it.
Then what’s the plan?

Like I said, it's already been figured out. You can't just pull the documents out of the suitcase; it's locked tight with a combination. Our good friend Kuznetsov has an idea: if we find an identical case and swap it on the sly, then we can frame the battalion commander himself while staying completely above suspicion. Let him deal with his own mess. So, Kuznetsov suggests trying to find the same kind of case. This commander must have gotten it from somewhere here in the Zone—one of the stalker craftsmen made it. There aren't many of those around, you can count them on one hand. Try to find out; start with Vergas. Maybe he can give you a lead. But you've got to resolve this quickly. We have four days at most. After that, a scheduled chopper arrives with supplies for the military, and they'll use it to ferry the case back to the mainland.\nHere, look... this is a photo of the suitcase. I'm uploading it to your PDA. If you find one like it, rush straight back to me. I'll make sure everything is organized so that not even a fly would suspect a thing.
I'll see what I can do.
No. I'm not taking this on right now.

Marked One, I'll make it worth your while... I'll tell you about my contact and throw in something for the road. If you solve this suitcase business, then Kuznetsov will be give you a bi-i-ig thank you when he returns. Remember—we only have four days, but I'll be waiting for you right here around the clock. Just don't come barging in at night; my sleep is sacred.
I was really counting on you, Marked One, for your information.
Hey, Sidorovich! I've got a certain briefcase here with documents from that destroyed convoy rusting away in the Gut. You usually have an interest in this kind of stuff...
Oho, that's a real stroke of luck! How did you even manage to get it... Actually, never mind. Hand it over!

Not so fast. I'm supposed to deliver this to a... client. He'll be very, very upset if I don't bring him this case. Besides, it looks like he knows exactly what's inside and will notice if anything's missing. Something tells me I won't live long if that happens.
Is that so... Well, what if I borrow it from you for just ten minutes? I've got a camera; I'll snap photos of everything real quick.
It's risky, of course... what if he figures out it was tampered with? Fine, I'll find a way to talk my way out of it. I'll leave you to it; I'm going to get some fresh air.
You know, I think I've changed my mind... What if the client gets pissed that the locks were messed with? Let's just pretend this conversation never happened.
Good man. Come back in 10 minutes.
So, how's the photoshoot going? Finished yet?
Look at you, getting all impatient. Fine, I've snapped the most interesting bits. Just sealing your suitcase back up now... Here, take it.
Don't you have a watch? Stop distracting me...
What about the payment?

I'll transfer some credits to you now, and here—take these supplies... Oh, right! In the papers from your case, I found a recipe for the Thorn artifact; copy it down for yourself. Just don't ask me how it got in there... Anyway, are we even? Here, take a bottle too; have a drink and relax. You're looking a bit jumpy. Watch those nerves!
Hard not to be jumpy when you could be taken out at any moment if you screw up...
D-damn, it hurts like hell... I'm dying...
How are you doing? Still with me?
For now... but the blood's gushing out. Give me a medkit, will you?
Here, take it.
Thanks, brother!
Sorry, brother. I don't have a medkit.
Search... the body... there should be one...
Oh, Marked One! What brings you here?
Just passing through. How are you holding up?
Just living day by day, can't complain.
I see you've settled in a new spot. What about the village?

To hell with them—Fanatic and Sidor both. They worked us to the bone. This isn't right, that isn't good enough... always nitpicking. I got fed up and we moved here. We earn our own keep now, don't owe anyone a thing.
And how do you survive? At least in the village you won't starve to death.

Yeah right, they toss you a bone like a dog and then run you ragged all day. Believe me, sometimes there isn't even time to sit by the fire and just talk about life with the guys.\nWe'll be fine here. Something always turns up. Besides, the world isn't without kind people.
You'd be better off doing some real work, hunting artifacts instead of asking for handouts. You won't survive on charity alone.

I was speaking figuratively. Actually, we go out hunting for arts after every Blowout, and we even make raids to the Garbage.
